alert.note: Alert for Butler; Cowley; Elk; Greenwood; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 11:14PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Elk, western Wilson, northeastern Cowley, southeastern Butler, western Woodson and Greenwood Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1114 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hamilton to 6 miles east of Latham. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eureka, Fredonia, Yates Center, Madison, Howard, Longton, Toronto, Hamilton, Severy, Fall River, Latham, Elk Falls, Benedict, Climax, Virgil, New Albany, Coyville, Eureka City Lake, Buxton and Eureka Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for south central and southeastern Kansas.

area.areaDesc: Butler; Cowley; Elk; Greenwood; Wilson; Woodson
